content: felted stars lisa mustelier 2008 these stars were made from undyed wool then dyed using food coloring before felting the stars pictured were used on the felted flute case use them to decorate a variety of projects they are fast and easy to make and a great way to use up those little bits of wool materials small amount worsted wool crochet hook size i or 9 gauge not important size does not change significantly during felting always make a sample and test for shrinkage for your project after felting large star approx 5 across medium star approx 4 across small star approx 3 across stitches used chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet treble triple crochet trb large star chain 4 join with slip_stitch to form ring chain 3 counts as 1st double_crochet 14 double_crochet in ring join with slip_stitch to 3rd st of chain 3-15sts *chain 7 turn slip_stitch in second chain from hook continue toward ring- single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet 2 trb skip 2 d on ring and join with slip_stitch repeat from * 4 more times - fasten_off medium star chain 4 join with slip_stitch to form ring chain 3 counts as 1st double_crochet 14 double_crochet in ring join with slip_stitch to 3rd st of chain 3-15sts *chain 5 turn slip_stitch in second chain from hook continue toward ring- single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet 1 trb skip 2 single_crochet on ring and join with slip_stitch repeat from * 4 more times - fasten_off small star chain 4 join with slip_stitch to form ring ch1 15 single_crochet in ring join with slip_stitch to beginning single_crochet *chain 4 turn slip_stitch in second chain from hook continue toward ring- single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet skip 2 single_crochet on ring and join with slip_stitch repeat from * 4 more times - fasten_off
